metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3476 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in OpenEXR's B44 uncompression functionality in versions before 3.0.0-beta. An attacker who is able to submit a crafted file to OpenEXR could trigger shift overflows, potentially affecting application availability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3476` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenexr22 - 2.2.0-10ubuntu2.6
openexr - 2.2.0-10ubuntu2.6
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: openexr package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.0-10ubuntu2.6').
